data.title: Top 10 Facts About The NFL!
data.meta_description: Welcome to our list of Top 10 Facts about the National Football League! The NFL is the biggest and most popular professional American football league in the world. It began more »
data.meta_site_name: Fun Kids - the UK's children's radio station
data.text:
Welcome to our list of Top 10 Facts about the National Football League! The NFL is the biggest and most popular professional American football league in the world.

It began in 1920 and is now one of the most profitable sports leagues in the world.

We’ll take a look at some of the most interesting facts about the league, its teams, and its players. So, without further ado, let’s get to the Top 10 Facts about the NFL.

1. NFL stands for National Football League.

You might have heard about the NFL.

It stands for National Football League and is the major professional American football league!

Embed from Getty Images

2. The NFL was founded in 1920 as the American Professional Football Association.

On 17th September 1920, there were ten football teams that came together in Ohio.

This created the American Professional Football Association which is now known as the National Football League (NFL).

That was over 100 years ago and it gets more and more popular every year, with even more teams taking part!

Embed from Getty Images

3. There are 32 teams in the NFL.

Within the NFL there are 32 American football teams.

They are divided into two conferences – the National Football Conference (NFC) and the American Football Conference (AFC).

There are 16 teams in each conference and those teams are split into East, North, South and West divisions. Each division has four teams!

Each team is based in a different city or area.

Embed from Getty Images

4. The National Football League is the highest level of professional American football!

The National Football League is the highest level of professional American football in the world.

That means that all of the top players are in each team and you have to be REALLY good!

5. There are over 200 games in the NFL during 17 weeks.

In each NFL season there are 256 games to be exact!

Each American football team plays 16 games across 17 weeks.

The season is between September and December. The 12 teams who make it through then go to the playoffs in January.

Then comes the Super Bowl!

Embed from Getty Images

6. The Super Bowl is the championship game of the NFL which happens every year.

The Super Bowl is the annual championship game of the NFL.

It’s where the best two American football teams go head to head.

The Super Bowl is the most watched sporting event in the United States! It’s also watched around the world.

It usually gets around 100 MILLION viewers!

Find out more about the Super Bowl here!

7. NFL Players earn an average of two million dollars a year!

Did you know that NFL players earn a lot?

The typical salary for an NFL player is 2 million dollars!

It depends on the players performance, team and contract – so they don’t all get paid the same.

Some of the highest paid players earn millions and millions!

Embed from Getty Images

8. You would struggle to get season tickets for The Green Bay Packers in a lifetime.

The Green Bay Packers are one of the oldest teams in the NFL, founded in 1919.

They have very enthusiastic fans and because of this have a very long waiting list for a season ticket.

There are over 100,000 people in the list and some won’t even get a ticket in their lifetime!

Embed from Getty Images

9. NFL players have to wear helmets to protect their heads.

It’s important to keep your head safe when you are playing contact sports.

NFL players didn’t have to wear helmets until 1943.

They now have to wear them in all games and even when they practice.

Embed from Getty Images

10. It costs around 7 million dollars for a company to advertise on the Super Bowl!

For a company to advertise on the Super Bowl with a 30 second advert – it’s going to cost them LOADS.

It is believed that a 30 second advert spot would cost a company a huge 7 million dollars!

That’s because there are so many people watching.

Do you think it’s worth it?

Embed from Getty Images

Send us your favourite facts!

Is there something we've missed? Got a fact you're dying to tell us? Submit it below and we could use it on a future Top 10 Facts page!

Remember to always ask an adult before filling out forms online.
